properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Nobelman's son
properties.Comments_: Only recorded in John 4:46-54 This is the first person healed under the ministry of Jesus. This wasn't an instant healing, but the Bible still calls it a miracle. Verse 52 …and the Nobleman’s son began to amend from that hour. The fever left him and he just began to get better and better and better. We don't need the physical and visible presence of Jesus to heal us. He wasn't there in person to deal with this man’s son. The man wanted Jesus to come in person, but He didn’t. Jesus just spoke a word go thy way, thy son liveth. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him and went his way. He had no physical evidence that his son was healed. Without sight and without signs.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Lame man at Bethesda
properties.Comments_: Only recorded in John. When this guy got his eyes off of the pool and onto Jesus, he got healed. Notice Jesus asked the man will you be made whole? He wants to bring this man to a place of making a decision from his will. … will you…? No man can receive much from God without a firm, decided choice. We must first see that it is God’s will to make us whole, and then choose to believe that.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Jairus' daughter
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. Here is an illustration of God’s absolute power to work when there’s nothing but death. Jesus’ response to Jairus after hearing that she had died, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole. Fear has a certain power of its own so Jesus only allowed The Father and Mother of the girl, and Peter, James, and John to go into the house where she was. Luke 8:54-55 And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying, Maid, arise. And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: 2 Blind Men
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew. This miracle happened just after the miracle of the raising of the dead of Jairus’ daughter. Jesus departed from there and two blind men followed him, saying have mercy on us. His response, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said to him, Yes, Lord. Then Jesus touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you. Once again, faith of the individual is mentioned. In fact, 12 of the 19 miracles mentions the person’s faith. It’s nearly impossible for healing to manifest without it.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Daughter of Syro-Phoenician Woman
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew and Mark. Notice from Mark 7:26 the Syrophoenician woman is seeking Jesus, … and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter. Jesus never addresses the devil, in fact her daughter is 50 miles away in a different town. He didn’t have to be present to deal with the devil. This woman’s persistent, overcoming faith took the promise. And Jesus told her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of your daughter.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Lunatic son
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. In Mark 9:21-23…notice Jesus asked how long this came unto him, and the father answers, but then goes right back into telling him about the condition…Jesus’ immediate response is if thou can believe, all things are possible to him that believes. It’s not a matter of, if the Lord can do it - it’s if the person can believe. That man realizes the responsibility that’s on him in verse 24. He doesn’t say “Lord I can’t believe”…. He says Lord I believe, help my unbelief. If we can believe from our hearts, no matter what our heads are telling us, we can make it. Faith will work in your heart with doubt in your head.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Man Born Blind
properties.Comments_: Recorded in the book of John. In this healing, John 9:5 Jesus says, As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world. Also remember in Matthew, he said you are the light of the world. Just because Jesus isn’t here in the flesh anymore doesn’t mean he’s not still the light of the world. The light didn’t go out when Jesus left in physical form. He’s here in spirit. Still performing miracles. Hebrews 13:8 Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and today, and for ever. He is the head and we are the body.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Blind man healed in Bethsaida
properties.Comments_: Recorded only in the book of Mark. Jesus took him by the hand and led him out of the city. Regarding our healing, Jesus may want to take us by the hand and lead us for awhile. He may want to lead us out of some things before he can get healing over to us. Also notice, healing is sometimes in stages, even under the ministry of Jesus. After Jesus prayed for him, his eyesight was better, but still not 100%. in Mark 8:24, …men that looked like trees. Sometimes progress will be in successive stages. Our job is to stand in faith and not waver just because we don’t see results.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Blind Bartemaus
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. From Mark 10 as Jesus came into Jericho, Blind Bartemaus began to cry out to Jesus and say in verse 47 … have mercy on me. Jesus didn’t acknowledge him, but he persistently cried out even more. Verse 48 Thou son of David, have mercy on me. Jesus finally took notice of him due to this persistent faith, and called him to himself, asking him what he wanted. Main point of this healing, Jesus tells him in verse 52 … Go thy way; thy faith has made thee whole. And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Capernaum demoniac
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Mark and Luke. Notice in Mark 1 after Jesus healed Peter's mother in law, he went to the synagogue on the sabbath day to teach. Notice verse 22, And they were astonished at his doctrine, because he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes. This demon possessed man was conversing with Jesus, and he addresses the demon in him saying, verses 25-26 And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace and come out of him. And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him. Important to notice, the demonic only recognizes legitimate authority, look at Acts 19:13-16. Also remember, Jesus gives us authority. See Luke 10:19, and Matthew 10:7-8.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Deaf man with a speech impediment
properties.Comments_: Testify or Comment

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Peter's mother in law
properties.Comments_: recorded in Mark, Matthew, and Luke. She took hold of the healing power when Jesus stood over her and lifted her by the hand. There was his mighty touch of help and healing, and there was her obedience. She received his extended hand, and she acted by rising up. To be healed, we have to meet his help and his power. It will not just fall on us.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Leper
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. This healing of the leper occurred soon after the healing of the multitude. Notice the request of this man, Mark 1:40 …. If thou will, Thou can make me clean. (41) And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth his hand, and touched him, I will; be thou clean. You see he was full of confidence in the power of Christ to heal, but he was uncertain about Jesus’ willingness to heal him. Christ’s answer to this man is the same for us today. Why? Because Jesus Christ is the same, yesterday, today, and forever. He’ll have the same answer today that he had then. If he’s the same, he’s going to have the same answer, the same power, the same word today that he had then.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Man with withered hand
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. This man had active, aggressive faith in order to receive Christ’s healing power. He wasn’t healed when Jesus said stretch forth thy hand. He had no power in himself to lift his hand, but because Jesus said stretch forth your hand, he did. When he put forth an act of faith, not doubting, but really expecting what Jesus said, it was done. The divine power of God moved to meet that obedient act. Faith is an act. It’s not passive.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Paralytic
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. In this particular healing the connection between sin and sickness comes to the surface. Jesus never said a word to the paralyzed man about being healed, but said man thy sins are forgiven thee. He recognized a deeper need that had to be met first before healing could manifest. Refer to 3 John 2 Beloved I wish above all things that thou may prosper and be in health even as thy soul prospers. Our physical healing is contingent upon our spiritual condition being made whole. After the sin issue was addressed, the paralyzed man had to take action. Jesus told him rise take up thy bed and walk. The paralyzed man had to have enough faith to get up, and as he made an effort, the power of God was released.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Woman with spirit of infirmity
properties.Comments_: Recorded in the book of Luke. Notice her condition was long standing, Luke 13:11, 18 long years, and her body was bound by a spirit of infirmity. Jesus said in v16 satan has bound her. Many times there's a connection between the devil, evil spirits, and sickness. In verse 12 Jesus called her to himself, implying that he required her to come to him first. She had to make an effort before he touched her, then as she came, he declared the work done. woman though art loosed from thy infirmity. He counted it done before it manifested.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Centurion's Servant
properties.Comments_: Only recorded in Matthew. We know this centurion didn’t have the religious background, yet he had faith. He recognized the authority of Christ’s word. The Centurion recognized Jesus’ authority in the spirit realm was similar to his authority in the natural realm. In the natural realm, this centurion had authority over a group of soldiers. They obeyed his orders. He recognized Jesus’ authority in the spiritual realm against the forces of disease and sin. He told Jesus in Matthew 8:8 …speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed. Later in verse 13 Jesus told him…Go thy way and as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee.

properties.Creator: Gwen@miraclemapper.com
properties.Name: Woman with issue of blood
properties.Comments_: Recorded in Matthew, Mark, and Luke. This is a striking example of faith’s absolute power to take everything that God promises us. Matt 19:26 with God all things are possible. Luke 1:37 nothing is impossible with God. She believed that she’d be healed, if I may but touch his clothes I shall be whole. Jesus said it was her faith that healed her. It wasn’t his faith. It was her faith. She believed, she came, she received. Then notice in Mark 5:29 And straightway the  fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague. Important to note she believed first, and then felt.
